Package gui.controllers

Class RestaurantMenuScreenController

java.lang.Object
gui.controllers.RestaurantMenuScreenController
public class RestaurantMenuScreenController extends Object
Controller for managing the menu screen of the chosen supplier. Handles item selection, cart and returning to the previous screen.
Author:
Tomer Rotman

    • showAlert

      private void showAlert(javafx.scene.control.Alert.AlertType type, String title, String message)
      Displays an alert dialog with the specified type, title, and message.
      Parameters:
      type - The type of the alert, determining its icon and default button set. This should be a value from the AlertType enum.
      title - The text to show in the title bar of the alert dialog.
      message - The main content text to be displayed in the alert dialog.

    • setSizePane

      private void setSizePane(boolean set)
      This method adjusts the opacity of the size title and enables/disables size selection buttons based on the input parameter. It also resets the selection state of all size buttons and hides any alert indicators.
      Parameters:
      set - A boolean value that determines whether to enable (true) or disable (false) the size selection functionality. When true, it makes the size selection fully visible and interactive. When false, it partially hides and disables the size selection.

    • setDonenessPane

      private void setDonenessPane(boolean set)
      Controls the visibility and interactivity of doneness selection components. This method adjusts the opacity of the doneness title and enables/disables doneness selection buttons based on the input parameter. It also resets the selection state of all doneness buttons and hides any alert indicators.
      Parameters:
      set - A boolean value that determines whether to enable (true) or disable (false) the doneness selection functionality.

    • setRestrictionsPane

      private void setRestrictionsPane(boolean set)
      Updates the visibility, prompt text, and enabled state of the restrictions input field and its title. This method configures the restrictions input field and its title based on the provided set flag. If set is true, the title is made fully visible, and the input field is enabled with a prompt text. If set is false, the title is half transparent, and the input field is disabled with no prompt text.
      Parameters:
      set - A boolean value indicating whether to show and enable the restrictions input field and title.

    • enableItemOptionsPane

      private void enableItemOptionsPane(Item item)
      Configures the item options pane based on the provided item, enabling customization options and handling item edits.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to be configured in the options pane.

    • disableItemOptionsPane

      private void disableItemOptionsPane()
      Disables the item options pane by hiding or disabling various UI components related to item customization.

    • addToCart

      private void addToCart(ItemInOrder item)
      Adds an item to the cart or updates its quantity if it already exists in the cart.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to be added to the cart.

    • createCartItemCard

      private javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane createCartItemCard(ItemInOrder item)
      Creates a card representation for an item in the cart.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to be represented in the cart.
      Returns:
      The AnchorPane representing the cart item card.

    • enableCart

      private void enableCart()
      Enables and displays the cart interface with items.

    • disableCart

      private void disableCart()
      Disables and hides the cart interface when it is empty.

    • updateQuantity

      private void updateQuantity(ItemInOrder item, RestaurantMenuScreenController.Operation op)
      Updates the quantity of an item in the cart and adjusts the cart display.
      Parameters:
      item - The item whose quantity is being updated.
      op - The operation to perform (add or reduce).

    • discardAllItems

      private void discardAllItems(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Clears all items from the cart, updates the cart display, and resets the total price.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggered by the discard action.

    • pressCheckout

      private void pressCheckout() throws IOException
      Handles the action when the user presses the checkout button. This method navigates to the CheckoutScreen by loading the corresponding FXML file.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while loading the FXML file.

      public Map<ItemInOrder,Integer> getCart()

      public ChooseRestaurantScreenController getRestaurantController()

    • pressBack

      private void pressBack(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handles the action when the user presses the back button. This method navigates back to the Choose Restaurant screen by loading the corresponding FXML file.
      Parameters:
      event - The action event triggered by pressing the back button.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while loading the FXML file.
